required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exergaming to Increase Physical Activity in Overweight/Obese Children and Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: Exergaming to Increase Physical Activity in Overweight/Obese Children and Adolescents

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary purpose of this study is to examine the effects of regular exergaming for 8 weeks in 24 overweight/obese children and adolescents (10-17 years) on maximal aerobic fitness (VO2max) and physical activity levels measured before and after (8 weeks) intervention period, and in addition at follow-up (12 weeks). We also wish to investigate the effects on markers of cardio metabolic health and body composition, measured at baseline, 8 weeks and 12 weeks follow-up.
Also, the participants gaming frequency will be registered throughout the 8 week period, as well as during the follow-up between 8 and 12 weeks. Aim of this study is to investigate if access to this game can provide health benefits for overweight/obese children and adolescents.

primary_outcome.measure: Daily time physical activity (moderate, vigorous and very vigorous)
primary_outcome.description: Measured by activity monitors (SenseWear Armband) which participants will wear for one week at start of intervention period and at 12 weeks.

secondary_outcome.description: Measured by activity monitors (SenseWear Armband) which participants will wear for one week at start of intervention period, 8 weeks and 12 weeks.
Measured by activity monitors (SenseWear Armband) which participants will wear for one week at start of intervention period, 8 weeks and 12 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily time in sedentary activity (< 3.0 metabolic equivalents = METs)
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by activity monitors (SenseWear Armband) which participants will wear for one week at start of intervention period, 8 weeks and 12 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily time in moderate intensity activity (3.0-6.0 metabolic equivalents = METs)
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by activity monitors (SenseWear Armband) which participants will wear for one week at start of intervention period, 8 weeks and 12 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily time in vigorous intensity activity
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by activity monitors (SenseWear Armband) which participants will wear for one week at start of intervention period, 8 weeks and 12 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily time in very vigorous intensity activity (>9.0 metabolic equivalents = METs)
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by activity monitors (SenseWear Armband) which participants will wear for one week at start of intervention period, 8 weeks and 12 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily average total physical activity duration
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by activity monitors (SenseWear Armband) which participants will wear for one week at start of intervention period, 8 weeks and 12 weeks.
Body composition assessed using bioelectrical impedance analysis (InBody 720)

secondary_outcome.measure: Fasting circulating glucose, as blood marker of cardiometabolic health
Fasting triglycerides, LDL-, HDL- and Total cholesterol, as blood marker of cardiometabolic health
Circulating insulin concentration, as blood marker of cardiometabolic health
glucose response to a 2 hour glucose tolerance test, as blood marker of cardiometabolic health
Daily time physical activity (moderate, vigorous and very vigorous)
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by activity monitors (SenseWear Armband) which participants will wear for one week at start of intervention period and at 8 weeks

arm_group.description: The participants in the Exergaming group will use the PlayPulse exergame for 45 minutes a minimum of two times per week for 8 weeks. Between 8 and 12 weeks the exergaming group will be provided with free access to the exergame but without the two mandatory exergaming sessions

intervention.description: The participants in the Exergaming group will use the PlayPulse exergame for 45 minutes a minimum of two times per week for 8 weeks. Between 8 and 12 weeks the exergaming group will be provided with free access to the exergame but without the two mandatory exergaming sessions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Defined as overweight/obese for age and sex
- Able to ride a bike for up to 60 minutes
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known cardiovascular disease
- Taking beta-blockers or anti-arrhythmic drugs
- Other diseases that restrict them from doing High-Intensity Training

overall_official.affiliation: Norwegian University of Science and Technology
Norwegian University of Science and Technology

facility.name: Department of Circulation and Medical Imaging
